DOC.brief_summary: Subacromial Impingement Syndrome ( SIS ) common cause shoulder pain high lifetime prevalence ( one three ) general population . In occupational population common upper extremity disorder . Symptoms include pain , variable degree mobility limitation less pronounced functional impairment . Conservative treatment usually first therapeutic option physiotherapeutic technique prove efficacy nevertheless treatment remain challenge . According investigator clinical experience , Diacutaneous Fibrolysis beneficial effect patient suffer SIS , one publish clinical trial evaluate manual technique previously . The investigator hypothesis add Diacutaneous Fibrolysis protocolized physiotherapeutic treatment provide good outcome . The investigator objective assess effect Diacutaneous Fibrolysis pain , mobility functional status patient suffer SIS . A double-blind ( patient evaluator ) randomize clinical trial carry two public centre Primary Health Care Spanish National Health System . The study protocol approve Clinical Research Ethics Committee Jordi Gol Institute Research Primary Health Care patient provide write consent . A hundred twenty patient clinical diagnosis SIS include randomly allocate one three group . All group receive daily protocolized treatment base therapeutic exercise , analgesic electrotherapy cryotherapy three week . Additionally , intervention group receive six session ( two week ) actual Diacutaneous Fibrolysis ; placebo group receive six session ( two week ) placebo Diacutaneous Fibrolysis , control group receive protocolized treatment . Pain intensity ( VAS ) , active range motion ( flexion , abduction , extension , external internal rotation ) functional status ( Constant-Murley score ) measure baseline , three week treatment three month end treatment .
DOC.criteria: Inclusion criterion : Over 18 year Diagnosed Subacromial Impingement Syndrome Signed write consent form . Exclusion criterion : Damaged skin and/or cutaneous lesion shoulder area , A concomitant treatment platelet antiaggregant agent Acute inflammatory condition shoulder Previous shoulder surgery A pending litigation court claim
